p: The DPPH and ABTS free radical scavenging activity assays were mostly used to evaluate the antioxidant effect of natural antioxidants [ 2]. Hence, the antioxidant activity of the D. dentiger roots ethanol crude extract was evaluated using ABTS and DPPH assays, and the results are shown in Table 2. The ethanol crude extract of D. dentiger roots showed the outstanding antioxidant activity, with IC 50 values of 255.8 ± 10.3 μg/mL for DPPH assay and 151.9 ± 6.5 μg/mL for ABTS assay; however, there were exhibited significant differences ( p < 0.01) comparable to those of the positive control V c with IC 50 values of 6.0 ± 0.2 and 1.2 ± 0.1 μg/mL, respectively.
